title: Preserve runtime hook identity and calling-convention tuple across lowering replay modes (issue #1862 / task M14-C003)
feature: M14 Lane C runtime hook and calling-convention tuple stability; issue #1862; task M14-C003; sequence 3; dispatch title: [Compiler][M14][Lane C][M14-C003] Wire runtime hook and calling convention path (Negative-Path Hardening)

mode_matrix.name: debug-o0
abi_requirements: runtime hook identity is resolved deterministically from selector metadata before boundary dispatch
hook calling-convention tuple remains context, selector, stateTag, payload, errorOut
hook return and errorOut transport remain correlated in deterministic success/failure contract
runtime_assertions: M14c003_dispatch returns 1 for rc == 0 with nil errorOut
M14c003_dispatch returns -1 when hook is missing or returns error transport

mode_matrix.name: optimized-o2
abi_requirements: optimized lowering preserves hook identity lookup and tuple layout from -O0
optimization does not reorder hook argument tuple or collapse error transport semantics
hook dispatch fail-closed behavior remains deterministic under optimization
runtime_assertions: M14c003_dispatch behavior remains equivalent to -O0 under optimization
negative-path sentinel return (-1) remains stable for hook signature drift

abi_field_stability.required_shape: runtime hook identity is bound to selector metadata without ambiguity
hook tuple is context -> selector -> stateTag -> payload -> outError
